title: Queen, Taylor Swift, Michael BublÃ© and the Albums With the Most Weeks at No. 1 on Top CatalogÂ Albums
summary: Itâ€™s an eclectic list, to say the least, encompassing pop, traditional pop, rock, hard rock, R&B, rap, country and reggae.
body: Post Malone â€™s hit-studded The Diamond Collection tops Billboard â€™s Top Catalog Albums chart for the 18th week, which allows it to join our list of albums that have topped that chart for 18 or more weeks. The Diamond Collection was released in 2023 to celebrate Posty becoming the artist with the most singles certified diamond by the Recording Industry Association of America. The Catalog Albums chart ranks the weekâ€™s most popular catalog albums in the U.S. Catalog albums are titles that are older than 18 months old and have fallen below No. 100 on the Billboard 200 â€” or holiday albums in their second holiday season. The chart was introduced in  Billboard  in the issue dated May 25, 1991. For the first 18 years of Top Catalog Albums, catalog albums werenâ€™t eligible to appear on the Billboard 200. That changed with the Dec. 5, 2009-dated chart, when catalog restrictions were lifted, turning the Billboard 200 into an all-inclusive list of the best-selling albums in the country, regardless of their age. (The adjustment came after  Michael Jackson â€™s death in June 2009, which triggered a sales explosion for his catalog titles. Jacksonâ€™s catalog compilation  Number Onâ€¦

title: Bruce Springsteen Slams ICE at New Jersey Benefit Show: â€˜Get the Fâ€”k Out of Minneapolisâ€™
summary: The legendary musician made a surprise appearance at the Light of Day Winterfest on Jan. 17.
body: Bruce Springsteen delivered a pointed message to ICE during a surprise appearance at a benefit concert over the weekend. Related Dave Matthews Blasts Trump Administration and ICE After Minnesota Shooting: ‘These Are Dark Times’ Duran Duran Pays Tribute to Renee Good After Fatal ICE Shooting in Minnesota DHS Slams Billie Eilish’s ‘Garbage Rhetoric’ About ICE After Singer Shares Posts Criticizing Minneapolis Shooting On Saturday (Jan. 17), the 76-year-old music icon â€” a longtime critic of President Donald Trump â€” made an unannounced performance at the 2026 Light of Day Winterfest, held at the Count Basie Theater in Red Bank, New Jersey. When introducing his 1978 song â€œThe Promised Land,â€ The Boss addressed the Trump administration with candid remarks. â€œI wrote this song as an ode to American possibility,â€ Springsteen said. â€œRight now we are living through incredibly critical times. The United States, the ideals and the value for which it stood for the past 250 years, is being tested like it has never been in modern times. Those values and those ideals have never been as endangered as they are right now.â€ He continued, â€œIf you believe in tâ€¦

title: Zach Bryanâ€™s â€˜With Heaven on Topâ€™ Debuts at No. 1 on BillboardÂ 200
summary: Plus, The Kid LAROI bows in the top 10.
body: Zach Bryan earns his second No. 1 album on the Billboard 200 chart (dated Jan. 24) as With Heaven on Top opens in the pole position with 134,000 equivalent album units earned in the United States in the week ending Jan. 15, according to Luminate. The 25-song set is the second leader for the singer-songwriter, who previously led the tally with his 2023 self-titled release. In total, Heaven marks the sixth top 40 set for Bryan, with five of those reaching the top 10. Related Queen, Taylor Swift, Michael BublÃ© and the Albums With the Most Weeks at No. 1 on Top Catalog Albums Anthony Albanese Reveals His Picks for Triple j's Hottest 100 of 2025 Thousands of Fans Celebrate Life of Legendary Grateful Dead Guitarist Bob Weir in San Francisco In early 2025, Bryan announced With Heaven on Top as a forthcoming EP. Then in July, he shared the projectâ€™s release date of Jan. 9, 2026. The set was issued via streaming services and as a widely available download for purchase, while a CD and vinyl release are expected in March. The albumâ€™s first-week was bolstered by its midweek deluxe reissue on Jan. 12 with 24 bonus acoustic tracks. Also in the top 10 of the latest Billboard 200, The Kâ€¦

title: â€˜Springsteen: Deliver Me From Nowhereâ€™ Ranks in the Top 20 on Billboardâ€™s List of Music Biopics With the Highest WorldwideÂ Grosses
summary: The films on this list cover a wide range of genres, including rap, classical, country, Latin and contemporary Christian.
body: Springsteen: Deliver Me From Nowhere received mixed reviews from critics, and underperformed at the boxoffice, but as of Sunday (Dec. 28) it has grossed $45.2 million worldwide, according to boxofficemojo.com . It ranks No. 19 on Billboard â€˜s list of music biopics with the highest worldwide grosses. Springsteen: Deliver Me From Nowhere isnâ€™t a traditional cradle-to-grave biopic — for one thing, its protagonist is, thankfully, still very much with us. Itâ€™s part of a subgenre of biopics which focuses on one fateful period in an artistâ€™s life. Springsteen: Deliver Me From Nowhere is set in the period following Springsteenâ€™s 1980 commercial breakthrough, The River (which spawned his first true pop smash, â€œHungry Heartâ€) where the artist felt compelled to make a low-key, acoustic album, Nebraska . All concerned understood that this project wouldnâ€™t have the same commercial potential as The River , which had spent four weeks at No. 1 on the Billboard 200. (And it didnâ€™t, peaking at No. 3.) But Springsteen has always been an artist, more than just a hitmaker, and this was the album he wanted and needed to make at that time. Here are the highest-grossing biopics of musicians in termâ€¦

title: â€˜Wicked: For Goodâ€™ Nears $525 Million in Worldwide Grosses: Full List of Top-Grossing Film Adaptations of BroadwayÂ Musicals
summary: The smash sequel is just the third adaptation of a Broadway musical to top the $500 million mark.
body: Wicked: For Good has grossed $523.5 million worldwide in its first nine weeks at the boxoffice, which puts it at No. 3 on Billboard â€™s list of the top-grossing films that are adapted from Broadway musicals. Our list is drawn from boxofficemojo.comâ€™s running tally of the 1,000 top-grossing films of all time in terms of worldwide grosses. Both Wicked: for Good and its predecessor, 2024â€™s Wicked , were adapted from the 2003 Broadway musical Wicked . The first Wicked film opened on Nov. 22, 2024. In just five weeks, it pulled ahead of Mamma Mia! to become the top-grossing film adapted from a Broadway musical. Wicked received 10 Oscar nominations on Jan. 23, 2025, including nods for both of its stars, Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande . It won two awards at the Oscars ceremony on March 2, 2025 â€” best costume design and best production design. Nominations for the 2026 Oscars will be announced on Thursday Jan. 22. Both Wicked and Wicked: For Good were directed by Jon M. Chu, whose hit-studded rÃ©sumÃ© includes a previous film adaptation of a Broadway musical, the 2021 movie version of Lin-Manuel Miranda â€™s breakout hit In the Heights . Eight film adaptations of Broadway musicals appear on Boâ€¦

title: Sabrina Carpenter Returns to â€˜SNLâ€™ for â€˜Snack Homiezâ€™ Sketch With A$AP Rocky & FinnÂ Wolfhard
summary: The rapper appeared as the musical guest on the Jan. 17 episode.
body: Sabrina Carpenter made a surprise cameo during Saturday Night Live on Jan. 17, joining musical guest A$AP Rocky and host Finn Wolfhard in a hilarious sketch. The 26-year-old pop star, who previously served as both host and musical guest in October 2025, returned to reprise her role in a sketch about teenage boys discussing their favorite snacks on a podcast. Related A$AP Rocky Recruits Danny Elfman, Performs ‘Don’t Be Dumb’ Songs in â€˜SNLâ€™ Debut Sabrina Carpenter’s Debut as ‘SNL’ Host: All of Her 8 Sketches Ranked A$AP Rocky’s ‘DON’T BE DUMB’: All 16 Tracks Ranked The nearly six-minute sketch, titled “Snack Homiez,” features a group of 12-year-old boys â€” Stranger Things star Wolfhard alongside cast members Chloe Fineman, Jane Wickline and Veronika Slowikowska â€” roasting each other and ranking their “goated snacks of 2026.” The dialogue was peppered with surprisingly accurate Gen Alpha slang, including phrases like “low-key,” “bro chill,” “no Diddy” and “chopped.” After sharing favorites like toasted Uncrustables, celery after soccer pracâ€¦

title: A$AP Rocky Recruits Danny Elfman, Performs â€˜Donâ€™t Be Dumbâ€™ Songs in â€˜SNLâ€™Â Debut
summary: The rapper delivered tracks from his new album during the Finn Wolfhardâ€“hosted episode.
body: A$AP Rocky made his debut as the musical guest on Saturday Night Live on Jan. 13, performing songs from his latest album. The Harlem-born rapper appeared on the late-night sketch comedy show for the first time, delivering three tracks from his long-awaited album, Donâ€™t Be Dumb , which was released the day before . Related Sabrina Carpenter Returns to ‘SNL’ for ‘Snack Homiez’ Sketch With A$AP Rocky & Finn Wolfhard A$AP Rocky’s ‘DON’T BE DUMB’: All 16 Tracks Ranked Watch A$AP Rocky Get Arrested & Beat the Odds in Chaotic ‘Punk Rocky’ Video Starring Winona Ryder For the opener, Rocky took the stage at Studio 8H for a cameo-filled performance of the album’s lead single, â€œPunk Rocky.â€ The back-alleyâ€“themed set featured iconic composer Danny Elfman on drums and Thundercat on bass. Mirroring the song’s chaotic music video , Rocky wore pink hair curlers and wielded a megaphone while performing in front of a spray-painted garage, with a cast of characters trashing the set in the background. Later in the show, he returned for a medley of â€œHelicopterâ€ and the albumâ€™s title track. In addition to hisâ€¦

title: Ed Sheeran Invites Fans to Choose Songs for Australia & New Zealand â€˜Loop Tourâ€™Â Shows
summary: â€œThereâ€™s five slots in the gig where Iâ€™ll play any song that you guys decide," Sheeran said.
body: Ed Sheeran is putting part of his Australia and New Zealand Loop Tour directly in the hands of fans. Ahead of the tourâ€™s opening night in Auckland, the singer-songwriter revealed that each show will include a live, fan-driven setlist element, with audiences invited to text in song requests that he will perform on the night. In an Instagram Story shared Thursday (Jan. 15), Sheeran explained that a phone number will appear on screens inside the venue before the show begins, allowing fans to submit the songs they want to hear. Those requests will be tallied in real time, with the most popular picks making it into the set. â€œSo tomorrow, if you are at the gig, there will be a big thing on the screen before it begins where it will say â€˜text in song recommendations,â€™â€ Sheeran said. â€œThereâ€™s five slots in the gig where Iâ€™ll play any song that you guys decide.â€ The singer added that the selections arenâ€™t limited to current hits or recent releases, and that he plans to prepare whatever fans vote for ahead of showtime. â€œSo whatever song you wanna hear at the gig, go look at the screen, text it, and itâ€™ll basically tally up the songs, and I will play those songs, whatever the song is,â€ he saiâ€¦

title: NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-11 to Discuss Space Station Science Mission
summary: After 167 days in space, the crew members of NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-11 mission will hold a news conference at 2:15 p.m. EST, Wednesday, Jan. 21, at the agencyâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston to discuss their science expedition aboard the International Space Station. NASA astronauts Zena Cardman and Mâ€¦
body: NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-11 crew returns to Ellington Fieldâ€™s Guppy Hangar in Houston on Jan. 16, 2026, from left to right is Roscosmos cosmonaut Oleg Platonov, NASA astronauts Mike Fincke, and Zena Cardman, and JAXA (Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency) astronaut Kimya Yui. NASA After 167 days in space, the crew members of NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-11 mission will hold a news conference at 2:15 p.m. EST, Wednesday, Jan. 21, at the agencyâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston to discuss their science expedition aboard the International Space Station. NASA astronauts Zena Cardman and Mike Fincke , JAXA (Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency) astronaut Kimiya Yui, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Oleg Platonov will answer questions about their mission. The crew members returned to Earth on Jan. 15, splashing down off the coast of San Diego, and arrived in Houston on Friday, where they will undergo standard postflight reconditioning and evaluations. NASA will provide live coverage on the agencyâ€™s YouTube channel . Learn how to watch NASA content through a variety of additional online platforms, including social media. Media are invited to attend in person or virtually. For in-person attendance, contact the NASA Jâ€¦

title: NASA Receives 15th Consecutive â€˜Cleanâ€™ Financial Audit Opinion
summary: For the 15th consecutive year, NASA received an unmodified, or â€œclean,â€ opinion from an external auditor on its fiscal year 2025 financial statements. The rating is the best possible audit opinion, certifying that NASAâ€™s financial statements conform with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles forâ€¦
body: Credit: NASA For the 15th consecutive year, NASA received an unmodified, or â€œclean,â€ opinion from an external auditor on its fiscal year 2025 financial statements. The rating is the best possible audit opinion, certifying that NASAâ€™s financial statements conform with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles for federal agencies and accurately present the agencyâ€™s financial position. â€œNASA has delivered a complete and reliable report of our fiscal operations, critical to our success for the Golden Age of exploration and innovation,â€ said NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman. â€œNASAâ€™s mission drives innovation in space exploration, scientific discovery, and aeronautics, pushing the boundaries of whatâ€™s possible. Our fiscal year 2025 budget fuels economic growth, drives the growing space economy, and keeps America first amidst increasing global competition.â€ The 2025 Agency Financial Report provides key financial and performance information and demonstrates the agencyâ€™s commitment to transparency in the use of American taxpayersâ€™ dollars. In addition, the 2025 report presents progress during the past year, and spotlights the array of NASA missions, objectives, and workforce advanced withâ€¦

title: NASA Develops Blockchain Technology to Enhance Air Travel Safety and Security
summary: Through a drone flight test at NASAâ€™s Ames Research Center, researchers tested a blockchain-based system for protecting flight data. The system aims to keep air traffic management safe from disruption and protect data transferred between aircraft and ground stations from being intercepted or manipuâ€¦
body: 3 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) By Supreet Kaur In an era where data security is critical to aviation safety, NASA is exploring bold new solutions. An Alta-X drone carries a custom built simulated Unmanned Aircraft Systems environment payload for the new blockchain system tests. Credit: NASA/Brandon Torres Navarette Through a drone flight test at NASAâ€™s Ames Research Center in Californiaâ€™s Silicon Valley, researchers tested a blockchain-based system for protecting flight data. The system aims to keep air traffic management safe from disruption and protect data transferred between aircraft and ground stations from being intercepted or manipulated.  For aviation and airspace operations to remain safe, users need to be able to trust that data is reliable and transparent. While current systems have been able to protect flight data systems, cyberthreats continue to evolve, requiring new approaches. NASA researchers found the blockchain-based system can safely transmit and store information in real time.  Blockchain operates like a decentralized database — it does not rely on a single computer or ceâ€¦

title: Out of This World Discoveries: Space Station Research in 2025
summary: As Earth completed its orbit around the Sun to close out 2025, the International Space Station circled our planet more than 5,800 times. Serving as humanityâ€™s unique laboratory in space, the station has hosted thousands of experiments and technology demonstrations, advancing science in ways that caâ€¦
body: 5 Min Read Out of This World Discoveries: Space Station Research in 2025 As Earth completed its orbit around the Sun to close out 2025, the International Space Station circled our planet more than 5,800 times. Serving as humanityâ€™s unique laboratory in space, the station has hosted thousands of experiments and technology demonstrations, advancing science in ways that cannot be replicated on Earth. In 2025 alone, more than 750 experiments supported exploration missions, improved life on Earth, and opened commercial opportunities in low Earth orbit. The space station continues to drive innovation by enabling human exploration of the Moon and Mars, transforming medical research, deepening our understanding of the universe, and fostering a growing commercial economy. Read through just a handful of 2025â€™s innovative research achievements from the orbiting laboratory. 25 Years of humans researching in orbit The International Space Station photographed in 2000 by the Expedition 1 crew. NASA On Nov. 2, 2025, humanity reached a milestone of cosmic proportions: 25 years of continuous human presence aboard the International Space Station. Since the first crew arrived on Nov. 2, 2000, NASA anâ€¦

title: NASAâ€™s Crawler Preps for Artemis II Rollout
summary: NASAâ€™s Crawler-transporter 2 moves toward the Vehicle Assembly Building at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Friday, Jan. 9, 2026. The crawler will transport NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket with the Orion spacecraft to Launch Complex 39B ahead of the Artemis II launch which will jouâ€¦
body: NASA/Ben Smegelsky NASAâ€™s Crawler-transporter 2 moves toward the Vehicle Assembly Building at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Friday, Jan. 9, 2026. The crawler will transport NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket with the Orion spacecraft to Launch Complex 39B ahead of the Artemis II launch which will journey Commander Reid Wiseman, Pilot Victor Glover, and Mission Specialist Christina Koch from NASA, and Mission Specialist Jeremy Hansen from the CSA (Canadian Space Agency), around the Moon and back to Earth no later than April 2026. The crawler-transporters have carried the load of taking rockets and spacecraft to the launch pad for more than 50 years at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. Each the size of a baseball infield and powered by locomotive and large electrical power generator engines, the crawler-transporters stand ready to keep up the work for the next generation of launch vehicles to lift astronauts into space; Crawler-transporter 2 in particular is integral to the Artemis missions. Image credit: NASA/Ben Smegelsky

title: Blooming Seas Around the Chatham Islands
summary: A vibrant display of phytoplankton encircled the remote New Zealand islands.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Blooming Seas Around theâ€¦ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe ğŸ›œ RSS Contact Us Search January 10, 2026 At about 800 kilometers (500 miles) east of New Zealandâ€™s South Island, the sparsely populated Chatham Islands are rugged, remote, and often inconspicuous. In January 2026, however, a ring of bright green and blue swirls in the ocean put a natural spotlight on the far-flung specks of land. A bloom of phytoplankton â€”tiny photosynthetic organisms that become visible to satellites when their numbers explodeâ€”encircled the Chatham Islands in austral summer. Surface currents and eddies carried the floating organisms into intricate wisps and swirls. The VIIRS (Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite) on the NOAA-20 satellite captured this image of the display on January 10, 2026. The Chatâ€¦

title: NASAÂ Adds Two F-15 Aircraft to Support Supersonic Flight Research
summary: Two retired U.S. Air Force F-15 jets have joined the flight research fleet at NASAâ€™s Armstrong Flight Research Center in Edwards, California, transitioning from military service to a new role enabling breakthrough advancements in aerospace. body: 3 min read Preparations for Next Moonwalk Simulations Underway (and Underwater) Oregon Air National Guard ground crew guides one of the NASA’s newest F-15 aircraft onto the ramp at the agencyâ€™s Armstrong Flight Research Center in Edwards, California, on Monday, Dec. 22, 2025. The retired U.S. Air Force F-15s come from the Oregon Air National Guardâ€™s 173rd Fighter Wing and will transition from military service to support NASAâ€™s flight research fleet. NASA/Christopher LC Clark Oregon Air National Guard and NASA flight crew look out across the desert while awaiting the arrival of the NASAâ€™s newest F-15 aircraft from the Oregon Air National Guardâ€™s 173rd Fighter Wing to NASAâ€™s Armstrong Flight Research Center in Edwards, California, on Monday, Dec. 22, 2025 NASA/Christopher LC Clark NASA’s newest F-15 aircraft arrive at the agencyâ€™s Armstrong Flight Research Center in Edwards, California, on Monday, Dec. 22, 2025. The two retired U.S. Air Force F-15s will support ongoing supersonic flight research for NASAâ€™s Flight Demonstrations and Capabilities Project and the Quesst missionâ€™s X-59 quiet supersonic research aircraft.
